div.p: Praise be to God always, June 17, 1560, in St. Gallen.
My heartfelt loyalty and love be with you, my beloved lord. Today, I received a letter from you; thus follows my prompt reply.

Regarding the matter with the Taler, concerning the stable master at Terviß, to whom your son is supposed to be indebted, I truly cannot know how the matter stands; however, I will send your enclosed letter, which you sent to me, to Zacharias Bürer. With the 2 guilders, I will instruct my servant that if he has not spent the money, he should not give it to anyone else; for it has already been arranged and paid in another way and, in God's name, with your handwriting to me, to whom I should give it, I will pay it immediately, so that you will not be inconvenienced in any way. Also, I have received the booklets and your present and thank you most highly, until I can also deserve it. I ask you, do not spare me.
May God with His grace and blessing be with you and all of us. Amen.
To the honorable Heinrich Bullinger, my greatly beloved lord, in Zurich.
